properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.allowed-security-policies
properties.description: A set of allowed security policy URIs. Default is to accept all and use the highest.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.application-name
properties.description: The application name
properties.defaultValue: Apache Camel adapter for Eclipse Milo

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.application-uri
properties.description: The application URI

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.channel-lifetime
properties.description: Channel lifetime in milliseconds

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.client-id
properties.description: A virtual client id to force the creation of a new connection instance

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.configuration
properties.description: All default options for client configurations. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.milo.client.MiloClientConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.discovery-endpoint-suffix
properties.description: A suffix for endpoint URI when discovering

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.discovery-endpoint-uri
properties.description: An alternative discovery URI

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the milo-client component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.key-alias
properties.description: The name of the key in the keystore file

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.key-password
properties.description: The key password

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.key-store-password
properties.description: The keystore password

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.key-store-type
properties.description: The key store type

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.key-store-url
properties.description: The URL where the key should be loaded from

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.max-pending-publish-requests
properties.description: The maximum number of pending publish requests

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.max-response-message-size
properties.description: The maximum number of bytes a response message may have

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.milo-client-connection-manager
properties.description: Instance for managing client connections. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.milo.client.MiloClientConnectionManager type.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.override-host
properties.description: Override the server reported endpoint host with the host from the endpoint URI.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.product-uri
properties.description: The product URI

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.request-timeout
properties.description: Request timeout in milliseconds

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.requested-publishing-interval
properties.description: The requested publishing interval in milliseconds

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.session-name
properties.description: Session name

properties.name: camel.component.milo-client.session-timeout
properties.description: Session timeout in milliseconds

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.application-name
properties.description: The application name

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.application-uri
properties.description: The application URI

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.bind-addresses
properties.description: Set the addresses of the local addresses the server should bind to

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.build-info
properties.description: Server build info. The option is a org.eclipse.milo.opcua.stack.core.types.structured.BuildInfo type.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.certificate
properties.description: Server certificate. The option is a java.security.cert.X509Certificate type.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.certificate-manager
properties.description: Server certificate manager. The option is a org.eclipse.milo.opcua.stack.core.security.CertificateManager type.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.certificate-validator
properties.description: Validator for client certificates. The option is a org.eclipse.milo.opcua.stack.core.security.CertificateValidator type.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.default-certificate-validator
properties.description: Validator for client certificates using default file based approach

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.enable-anonymous-authentication
properties.description: Enable anonymous authentication, disabled by default

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the milo-server component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.namespace-uri
properties.description: The URI of the namespace, defaults to urn:org:apache:camel

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.path
properties.description: The path to be appended to the end of the endpoint url. (doesn't need to start with '/')

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.port
properties.description: The TCP port the server binds to

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.product-uri
properties.description: The product URI

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.security-policies
properties.description: Security policies

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.security-policies-by-id
properties.description: Security policies by URI or name. Multiple policies can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.user-authentication-credentials
properties.description: Set user password combinations in the form of user1:pwd1,user2:pwd2 Usernames and passwords will be URL decoded

properties.name: camel.component.milo-server.username-security-policy-uri
properties.description: Set the UserTokenPolicy used when
